policy_name: Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) Devices for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnea

criteria: Diagnosis of OSA confirmed by polysomnography (sleep study)
Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) â‰¥ 5 events per hour
Patient demonstrates medical necessity for PAP therapy
Patient has been evaluated by treating physician

device_replacement_criteria.standard_replacement_timeframe: 5 years from date of original device
early_replacement_criteria: Device malfunction that cannot be repaired cost-effectively
Loss or irreparable damage to device
Change Inpatient condition requiring different PAP modality

compliance_requirements.minimum_frequency: 70% of nights (21 out of 30 consecutive days)
compliance_requirements.documentation: Objective compliance data from PAP device required

rationale: Patient has confirmed OSA diagnosis with AHI 8.9/hr documented by polysomnography
Current PAP device is 5+ years old, meeting standard replacement timeframe
Patient demonstrates excellent compliance with CPAP therapy (Epworth score 3/24)
Medical necessity clearly documented for continued PAP therapy
Replacement aligns with Medicare LCD L33718 criteria

medical_necessity_justification.clinical_benefit: PAP therapy prevents serious complications of untreated OSA including cardiovascular events, stroke, diabetes complications, cognitive impairment, and motor vehicle accidents
medical_necessity_justification.evidence_based: Strong evidence supports PAP therapy as first-line treatment for OSA per American Academy of Sleep Medicine guidelines
medical_necessity_justification.patient_specific_factors: Patient with obesity (BMI 45.6), multiple comorbidities, and documented benefit from current PAP therapy requires uninterrupted treatment
